data.title: Glossary of Item Setup Attributes
data.meta_description: If you’re unsure how to complete an item setup spreadsheet from Item 360, learn what the attributes mean and get examples of valid values.
data.text:
Attribute Name

OIF Name

Definition

Valid Data Type

Valid Data Length or Closed List Options

Example Value

Sellable GTIN

The Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) that identifies the product's consumable (selling) unit and is used to identify an item at any point in the supply chain.

GTIN refers to the data structure (not symbology) used to identify the scannable item, case, inner pack, or pallet that make up the hierarchy.

Alphanumeric

14 characters, including a check digit

If your GTIN has fewer characters, add preceding zeros.

00123456781011

GDSN Sync Status

The Trade Item Sync Status Code defines the status of the Trade Item being synced from GDSN.

Closed list

Not Synchronized

Synchronized

Not Synchronized

9-Digit Supplier Id

Supplier Number

A combination of the 6-digit Supplier Number, 2-digit Department Number and 1-digit Sequence Number.

Alphanumeric

9 characters

012345010

Supplier Stock Number

Supplier Stock Number

The number that appears on the Walmart in-store shelf label to identify the product to customers. Also used by Walmart supply chain.

Alphanumeric

15 characters

128475657

Unit Cost

Unit Cost

The price Walmart is paying the supplier per unit (i.e., the orderable cost divided by the orderable quantity).

Decimal

10 characters

Include up to 4 digits to the right of the decimal point, and do not use commas or currency symbols.

23.52

Is a Break Pack?

Indicates whether the orderable configuration needs to be opened at the Walmart DC in order to send the next level lower Trade Item to the store.

Closed list

No

Yes

No

Pallet Ti

Pallet Ti

The number of supplier cases per layer on a pallet (tier on a pallet). Ti and Hi are used for traffic planning (shipping) and slotting merchandise in the warehouse.

Number

11 characters

7

Pallet Hi

Pallet Hi

The number of layers on a supplier pallet. Ti and Hi are used for traffic planning (shipping) and slotting merchandise in the warehouse.

In Grocery, both the TI and HI can vary by DC.

Number

11 characters

5

Orderable GTIN

The Global Trade Item Number that identifies the pack ordered from a supplier and shipped to a Walmart facility.

Alphanumeric

14 characters, including a check digit

If your GTIN has fewer characters, add preceding zeros.

00123456789104

Walmart Department Number

Department

The financial department under which items are ordered or replenished.

Fineline Number

Fineline

Part of the item number grouping hierarchy, the fineline number is created by merchandising to group items more specifically than the department number.

Number

4 characters

0123

Buying Region Code

Buying Region Code

The code used to assign item ownership to a region.

Closed list

0 - Corporate (items that are shared among all regions. Use this code if selling both online and in stores.)

1 - Alaska

2 - Hawaii

3 - Puerto Rico

0 - Corporate

Replenishment Item Type

Item Type

Determines the type of replenishment for an item.

Closed list

03 - Promotional

20 - Warehouse

22 - Seasonal Warehouse

33 - Assembly Distribution

40 - Import Warehouse

42 - Import Seasonal Warehouse

43 - Import

20 - Warehouse

Replenishment Item Sub Type

Sub Type

Combined with the Item Type, this determines how the product is ordered and delivered to the store.

Item Type 03, Sub Type 00 = Promotional General Order

Item Type 20, Sub Type 00 = Warehouse Regular Item

Item Type 40, Sub Type 00 = Warehouse Import Item

If an item is going to be on a label mod, the sub type needs to be 14 if it is not going to be replenished.

Number

3 characters

03

Store Label Description

Item Description 1

The description displayed as the primary description on the shelf label at the store. Also known as "Shelf Label Item Description 1".

Alphanumeric

20 characters

Faded Glory Jeans

Store Receipt Description

UPC Description

For Stores Only: A short, simple description that appears on the register when the item is scanned and prints on the customer's receipt so they can identify their purchase.

Alphanumeric

12 characters

Faded Glry

Brand Code

Brand

Refer to Retail Link to find your brand ID (.com brand Code = Stores Brand ID).

If you do not have a brand code, please submit a request to your store counterparts. Use 84602 if not provided.

Number

6 characters

134167

Warehouse Alignment Code

Whse Alignment

Ensures the correct warehouse location is generated on purchase orders for merchandise that has different needs during distribution.

Closed list

AP - Apparel Network

AS - Assembly

CI - Regional Network

DI - Distribution Freight

DS - Searcy GRS

Segregation Code

Segregation Code

Used to classify items for slotting requirements to allow segregation of merchandise.

Closed list

1 - General Handling

10 - Ammunition-Metal Jacket

11 - Paint

12 - Pesticides/Insecticides

13 - HBA

2 - HBA Oral

3 - Chemical

4 - Contacts Food

5 - Human Food

6 - Medicine

7 - List 1

8 - Animal Food

9 - Ammunition-Nonmetal Jacket

5 - Human Food

Commodity ID

Commodity ID

A number used to group together items that can be shipped on the same truck.

Closed list

100 - Commodity Group 1 (Processed Soy Items: BBQ Riblets, Dino Nuggets, Portabella Burgerriffics, Spinach Nuggets & Veggetinos (Meatless Meatballs))

101 - Commodity Group 2 (Apple Cider-Shelf Stable, Apple Cider (non-shelf stable), Artichokes, Avomex Guacamole Dip, Coconuts, Corn, Peeled Garlic, Horseradish, Lemon Grass, Mushrooms, Oriental Wraps, Noodles, Tofu, Green Peanuts, Salad Dressing/Dips, Sun Chokes, Tamarindo Bean, Vegetarian Items & Yogurt Fruit Dips)

102 - Commodity Group 3 (Blackberries, Blueberries, Cranberries, Raspberries, Strawberries, Cherries & Figs)

103 - Commodity Group 4 (Kumquat, Lemon/Lime 2#, Lemons, Oranges, Blood Oranges, Orange Juice, Tangerines, Mandarin Oranges, & Uglifruit or Unique Fruit)

104 - Commodity Group 5 (Croutons/Salad Fixings, Caramel Apple Dip, Chocolate, Fruit Dip, Peanut Butter Apple Dip, Dried Apricots, Dried Mangos, Dried Mushrooms, Dried Peppers, Dried Bell Peppers, Dried Tomatoes, Dried Vegetables, Filberts, Fresh Squeezed Juice, Fruit Glaze, Lemon/Lime (Realemon Juice), Onion Kits – Onion Blossoms, Pinto Beans, Minced Garlic, All Nuts, Peanuts, Spice/Mixes & Waymouth Farms)

105 - Commodity Group 6 (All World Variety and Friedas Items)

106 - Commodity Group 7 (Batata, Boniato, Cactus Leaves, Canela, Husk Corn, Fresh Crepes, Garlic, Elephant Garlic, Ginger Root, Hispanic Items, Malanga, Manzanilla, Borler and Pearl Onion, Piloncillo, Shallot, Taboli, Taro Root, Wild Rice & Yucca Root)

107 - Commodity Group 8 (All Onions & Potatoes not listed in other Groups)

108 - Commodity Group 9 (Candy Apples, Grapefruit, Limes (Mexican, Key, Persian & Tahiti), Pineapple & Pummelo)

109 - Commodity Group 10 (Apples, Apple/Orange Bag, Apricots-Stonefruit, Chayotes, Dates, Fruit Baskets, Grapes, Gold and Green Kiwi Fruit, Lychee, Mixed Fruit, Nectarines, Peaches, Pears, Persimmon, Plums, Prunes, Pluots, Pomegranates, Quinces, Star Fruit or Carambola)

110 - Commodity Group 11 (Alfalfa Sprouts, Anise or Fennel, Fresh Beans, Fresh Beets, Bok Choy, Broccoli, Brussels Sprouts, Cabbage, Carrots, Cauliflower, Celery, Chard, Chestnuts, Cilantro, Cut Fruit, Coleslaw, Daikon, Dip & Stix, Endive, Escarole, Fresh Herbs, Greens, Kale, Kohlrabi, Leeks, Lettuce, Micro Kits, Green Onions, Packaged Salad Mix, Parsley, Parsnips, Peas, Pom Wonderful Juice, Reeser’s Salads, Radishes, Rhubarb, Rutabagas, Soup Mix, Spinach, Stir Fry, Tamarillo, Turnips, Value Added (Processed Veg.), Vegetable Trays, Water Chestnuts & Watercress)

111 - Commodity Group 12 (Cucumbers, Eggplant, Feijoas, Horned Melons, Jicama, Okra, Peppers, Squash & Tomatillo)

112 - Commodity Group 13 (Avocado, Cantaloupes, Cherimoya, Guava, Honeydew Melons, Mango, Papaya, Passion Fruit, Pears & Variety Melons)

113 - Commodity Group 14 (Tomatoes)

114 - Commodity Group 15 (Pumpkins & Watermelons)

115 - Commodity Group 16 (Bananas, Variety Bananas & Plantain)

116 - Commodity Group 17 (Booming Plants, Cut Flowers, Cymbidium, Christmas Trees & Wreaths)

117 - Commodity Group 18 (Cut Tropical & Foliage Plants)

118 - Commodity Group 19 (18 in. Christmas Swan or Goose Ivy, 28 in. Ivy Tree w/Lights, Holiday Christmas Basket Ivy & 5 to 6 in. Bonsai)

119 - Commodity Group 20 (Colored/Mini Sweet Peppers & Squash)

120 - Commodity Group 21 (Natural (Brick, Cheddar, Camembert, Cottage, Cream, Limburger & Neulchate), Process (American, Brick, Limburger & Swiss), Cream Cheese, Roquefort (Natural), Swiss (Natural), Cheese Foods, Deli Salads, Juice (Chilled), Butter, Margarine/Spreads, Biscuits, Tortilla Shells, Yogurt & Pudding, Fluid Milk, Creamers, Sour Cream, Cottage Cheese, Dips, Egg Substitute, Eggs, Commercial Bread, & Fresh Tortillas)

121 - Commodity Group 22 (Bacon, Bologna, Franks, Braunschweiger/Liver Sausage & Loaves, Sliced Cold Cuts, Dried Beef, Hams, Smoked Meats, Pork Sausage, Reeser’s Salads, Salads & Sausage)

122 - Commodity Group 23 (Fresh Pizza & Deli Loaf Meats)

123 - Commodity Group 24 (Ground Meats, Case Ready, Beef, Pork, Poultry, Fresh Lamb, Veal & Salt Cured Ham)

124 - Commodity Group 25 (All Fresh Seafood)

125 - Commodity Group 26 (All Frozen Seafood, Raw Bread Dough, Donuts, Cookies, Breads, Turnovers, Cinnamon Rolls, Pre- Baked (Thaw & Serve), Un-Baked (Frozen Dough), Cakes, Un-decorated (Incl. Cheesecake), Decorated (Iced), Pies (All), Frozen Meats, Frozen Breads & Frozen Snacks)

126 - Commodity Group 27 (All Live Seafood)

127 - Commodity Group 28 (Ice Creams & Novelties)

128 - Commodity Group 29 (Floral Gift in a Balloon Acces. & Floral Picks/Misc.)

132 - Commodity Group 30 (Shelf Stable Items)

113 - Commodity Group 14

In Store Shelf Life (days)

Shelf Life Days

The minimum number of days that must remain in the life of the product in order to receive it at the store.

Number

7 characters

12

Warehouse Rotation

Whse Rotation

Indicates how an item is rotated in a warehouse (grocery or regional).

1 (normal) indicates rotation can be determined by the DC.

2 indicates strict first in, first out rotation.

Closed list

1 - Normal - Rotate by Received Date

2 - Strict - Rotate by Received Date

3 - Strict - Rotate by Sell By Date

4 - Strict - Rotate by Sequence Number

1 - Normal - Rotate by Received Date

Warehouse Area

Whse Area

Identifies certain types of merchandise to be stored in specific areas of a warehouse.

Closed list

01 - Fresh Meat

02 - Fresh Deli

03 - Fresh Dairy

04 - Frozen

05 - Ice Cream

06 - Dry Grocery

07 - Wet Produce

08 - Dry Produce

09 - Cold Produce

10 - Shoes

11 - General Merchandise

04 - Frozen

Pallet Rounding Percent

Pallet Round Pct

The supplier Order Rounding Percent represents the percentage of a full warehouse pallet that will trigger a full pallet pull. For example, if the rounding percent is 75% and:

The store order is 80%, then the store will receive a full pallet.

The store order is 60%, then the store will receive only 60% of the pallet.

The valid range is 1 to 100%. The default for Grocery items in a Grocery DC is 100%.

Decimal

5 characters

0.8

Orderable Pack Weight Format

Supplier Pack Weight Format

Defines whether the Trade Item Pack Weight is fixed or variable.

Closed list

Fixed - The weight of the Trade Item is consistently the same

Variable - The weight of the Trade Item entered is an average, and the actual weight may be higher or lower

Fixed

Sold by Weight / Replenished by Unit

Sold by Weight/Repl by Unit

Indicates whether the item is sold to the customer by weight using a random weight barcode (price embedded) and is ordered from the warehouse in units determined by the pack quantity.

Closed list

No

Yes

No

Shelf 2 - Size

Shelf 2 / Size

A 6-character field used to further describe customer selection points about the merchandise. It's displayed as one of two choices of additional information the shelf labels in the stores and clubs.

Previously referred to as Size; can be used for descriptors specific to the product.

Alphanumeric

6 characters

Large

Is Variable Price Comparison

Variable Comp. Ind

Indicates an item that Walmart sells by the each (e.g., a whole chicken) and the competitor may sell by the pound (e.g., a whole chicken by the pound).

This flag allows the cashier to match the competitor's price the item at the register.

Closed list

No

Yes

Yes

Is Weighable at Register

Scalable at Register Ind

Indicates whether an item is weighable at front register.

Closed list

No

Yes

Yes

Backroom Scale Indicator

Backroom Scale Ind

Indicates if backroom scales are used to ticket merchandise with the total retail based on the weight or count of the goods placed on the scale and price per measurement.

The total amount is applied to the printed price embedded barcode, which allows the cashier to scan at the register and charge the customer the correct amount.

Items marked Yes will be required to be weighed and marked before the customer takes the goods to the register.

Used mostly in deli, bakery, produce, and meat.

Closed list

No

Yes

Yes

Each > Each GTIN

The Global Trade Item Number that identifies the Each.

Alphanumeric

14 characters, including a check digit

If your GTIN has fewer characters, add preceding zeros.

00123456789104

Each > Depth (in)

If the Each is the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), front to back, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Each is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

10

Each > Height (in)

If the Each is the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Each is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

40

Each > Width (in)

If the Each is the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), left to right, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Each is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

80

Each > Weight (lbs)

The weight (in pounds) of the Each, including all of its packaging materials.

Decimal

11 characters

Inner Pack > Inner Pack GTIN

The Global Trade Item Number that identifies the Inner Pack (also known as a break pack, warehouse pack, inner case, or pick).

Alphanumeric

14 characters, including a check digit

If your GTIN has fewer characters, add preceding zeros.

10123456789106

Inner Pack > Depth (in)

If the Inner Pack is the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), front to back, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Inner Pack is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

10

Inner Pack > Height (in)

If the Inner Pack is the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Inner Pack is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

40

Inner Pack > Width (in)

If the Inner Pack is the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), left to right, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Inner Pack is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

80

Inner Pack > Weight (lbs)

The weight (in pounds) of the Inner Pack, including all of its packaging materials.

Decimal

11 characters

100

Inner Pack > Qty of Sellable Items

Warehouse Pack Qty

The total number of sellable units in the Inner Pack.

Number

10 characters

10

Case > Case GTIN

The Global Trade Item Number that identifies the Case (also known as a vendor pack, orderable pack, shipping case, shipping pack, full case, or supplier pack).

Alphanumeric

14 characters, including a check digit

If your GTIN has fewer characters, add preceding zeros.

20012345681012

Case > Depth (in)

If the Case is the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), front to back, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Case is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

20

Case > Height (in)

If the Case is the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Case is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

80

Case > Width (in)

If the Case is the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), left to right, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Case is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

160

Case > Weight (lbs)

The weight (in pounds) of the Case, including all of its packaging materials.

Decimal

11 characters

120

Case > Qty of Sellable Items

The total number of sellable units in the Case.

Number

10 characters

100

Pallet > Pallet GTIN

The Global Trade Item Number that identifies the Pallet.

Alphanumeric

14 characters, including a check digit

If your GTIN has fewer characters, add preceding zeros.

30012345681012

Pallet > Depth (in)

If the Pallet is the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), front to back, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Pallet is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The longest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

120

Pallet > Height (in)

If the Pallet is the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Pallet is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The vertical measurement (in inches), top to bottom, with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

120

Pallet > Width (in)

If the Pallet is the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), left to right, with the product sitting on its natural base and facing forward.

If the Pallet is not the consumable (sellable) unit: The shortest horizontal measurement (in inches), with the product sitting on its natural base.

For more information, see Understanding Trade Item Dimensions.

Decimal

9 characters

200

Pallet > Weight (lbs)

The weight (in pounds) of the Pallet, including all of its packaging materials.

Decimal

11 characters

500

Pallet > Qty of Sellable Items

The total number of sellable units in the Pallet.

Number

10 characters

500

Product Data Provider GLN (Global Location Number)

Defines the Global Location Number of the supplier organization that is providing the Trade Item GTIN information.

Alphanumeric

13 characters

0012345678910

Allowed Time in Warehouse (days)

Warehouse Min Life Quantity

The expected life, in days, of the product once it's received at the warehouse. This tells the warehouse how long they have to get the item to the store.

The merchandise may be rejected by the DC if there is less than the guaranteed number of days remaining in the life of the product.

Number

4 characters

15

Minimum Days of Shelf Life at Arrival

Variance Days

The seller's determination of the minimum number of calendar days of shelf life of the product, based upon the expiration date on the product, upon receipt by the buyer.

Number

6 characters

10

PLU Number

Plu Number

The Price Look-Up (PLU) Number is utilized through the weighing system – either through the scales at the back or at the front registers. The price is set by the weight of the item.

Number

5 characters

4011

Replaced Item Number

Replaces Item

If the new item submission is replacing a current Walmart Item Number, the current item number is the replaced item number.

Number

15 characters

123456789

Item Effective Date

Supply Item Effective Date

The date (yyyy-mm-dd) that the item is valid and/or replenishable for the store.

Date

12 characters

2020-09-30

Send Traits

Send Traits

The number for a list of traits that will be used to send an item to the stores that result from the trait logic.

Alphanumeric

209 characters

1460
